problem.markdown: Q1. The suface of zero elevation around the earth , which is slightly irregular and curved , is known as ( ) mean sea level ( ) geoid surface ( ) level surface (x) horizontal surface Q2. A closed contour line with one or more higher altitude contours inside it represents (x) A hill ( ) A depression ( ) A cliff ( ) A cave ( ) A well Q3. Two contour lines of different elevations can cross each other only in case of ( ) A well ( ) A cliff ( ) A cave ( ) (A) or (B) above (x) (B) or (C) above Q4. The limit of water level of a skill lake, represents ( ) level surface ( ) a horizontal surface (x) both longitudinal and cross sections are required contour line ( ) a concave surface Q5. A closed contour line with one or more lower value contours inside indicated (x) A depression ( ) A hillock ( ) A cave ( ) A cliff ( ) A ridge Q6. If the contour lines are equally spaced they indicated ( ) Steep slope ( ) Depression ( ) Plain ground (x) Uniform slope ( ) Valley Q7. Identify the incorrect statement, if any ( ) Two contours having the same elevation cannot untie and continue as one line ( ) A single contour cannot split into two lines ( ) A contour line must close upon itself, though not necessarily within the limits of the map ( ) Contour lines cross a valley at right angles (x) Contour lines close together indicate gentle slope Q8. The limit of water level in a still lake represents a ( ) Contour gradient ( ) Level surface (x) Contour line ( ) Horizontal surface ( ) None of the above Q9. The direction of steepest slope at a point on a contour is ( ) Along the contour ( ) At 45 to contour (x) At 90 to the contour ( ) At 180 to the contour ( ) Parallel to the contour Q10. Contour maps are used for ( ) Determination of intervisibility between two points ( ) Measurement of drainage areas ( ) Calculation of reservoir capacity ( ) Drawing of sections (x) Any or all of the above Q11. The constant vertical distance between two adjacent contours of any area is called ( ) The contour interval ( ) The level distance ( ) The level difference ( ) The horizontal interval (x) The contour gradient Q12. The best method of interpolation of contours in direct method of contouring, is by ( ) Interpolation ( ) Auxiliary contouring (x) Computations ( ) Estimation ( ) All of the above Q13. The topography of a very flat represents by ( ) Drawing Contour lines at large intervals ( ) Drawing contour lines for very small gradient ( ) Drawing contour lines for very small intervals (x) By stipulating spot level with indications ( ) By giving spot levels at close intervals Q14. An imaginary line on the ground joining the points of equal elevation, is known as ( ) Equal elevation line ( ) Iso-elevation line ( ) Constant level line (x) Contour ( ) None of the above Q15. The vertical distance between two consecutive contours is known as ( ) Superelevation ( ) Elevation rise ( ) Contour elevation ( ) Contour factor (x) Contour interval Q16. Contour lines of different elevations can intersect only in case of ( ) Valley ( ) Ridge ( ) Mountains (x) Cave ( ) Rivers Q17. Contour lines of different elevation can unite to form one line only in the case of (x) Vertical cliff ( ) Cave ( ) Plane ground ( ) valley ( ) River bed Q18. Contour lines spaced closely indicate ( ) Gentle slope (x) Steep slope ( ) Plane ground ( ) Valley ( ) Vertical cliff Q19. A plane surface on a contour map is indicated by ( ) Far apart lines ( ) Close together lines (x) Series of straight, parallel and equal spaced contours ( ) Mutually crossing contours ( ) Closed contour lines Q20. On a contour map, a hill is usually indicated by ( ) Closed contour lines ( ) Closed contour lines with one or more higher ones inside it (x) Closed contour lines with one or more lower ones inside it ( ) Two contour lines of same elevation uniting and continuing as one line ( ) None of the above Q21. In case the contour lines are parallel and equidistant for a place, then the place will be ( ) a plane ground (x) having uniform slope ( ) having steep slope ( ) having gentle slope ( ) None of the above

Closed contour lines with one or more lower ones inside it
